c4

Interface Agent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlphaBetaAgent, AlphaBetaTDSAgent, MCTSPlayer, RandomAgent, TDSAgent

    public interface Agent
    An Interface-Implementation for Connect-Four Agents
    Author:
    Markus Thill

    • Method Detail

      • getAgentState

        Agent.AgentState getAgentState()
        Returns:
        The current state of the Agent.

      • getBestMove

        int getBestMove(int[][] table)
        Parameters:
        table - current board
        Returns:
        Best move for the current Player

      • getBestMove

        int getBestMove(int player,
              int[] colHeight,
              double[] vTable)
        Based on an already existing VTable e.g., getNextVTable(int[][], boolean), select the best move for the player to move. In some cases the agent determines the values for all after-states of a position. If all these values are already available it is not necessary to call the method getBestMove(int[][]), which often would need extra time. Example: If all the values for the after-states were already calculated by a treesearch-algorithm, then we do not have to start the search again, just to find the best move, since the best move is simply determined by the after-state which maxizimizes the final outcome.
        Parameters:
        player - player, to find best move for
        colHeight - an Array containing the heights of all columns
        vTable - Values for all columns
        Returns:
        Best move for a player using the param vTable

      • getScore

        double getScore(int[][] table,
              boolean putInRange)
        For a given position determine the game-theoretic value, thus the outcome of the game, starting from this position. The implementation should be able to scale the score into the range -1 (Win Red) and +1 (Win Yellow) with 0 indicating a draw.
        Parameters:
        table - 7x6-board
        putInRange - put score in range -1 .. +1
        Returns:
        Score (Value) for the given board

      • getNextVTable

        double[] getNextVTable(int[][] table,
                     boolean putInRange)
        Determine for a given position the values of all possible actions (after-states).
        Parameters:
        table - 7x6-board
        putInRange - put values in range -1 .. +1
        Returns:
        table containing the values for each column of the board.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Name of the Agent

      • semOpDown

        void semOpDown()
        If Threads are used, which multiply access the agents, then ensure that only one thread has mutual exclusive access. This is the DOWN-Operation on the semaphore (MUTEX). This method should be used in combination with semOpUp().

      • semOpUp

        void semOpUp()
        If Threads are used, which multiply access the agents, then ensure that only one thread has mutual exclusive access. This is the UP-Operation on the semaphore (MUTEX). This method should be used in combination with semOpDown().
